name: Feversham Arms Hotel & Verbena Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful 2 night stay at Feversham Arms to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. Lovely decorated room and despite being described a petite double it was spacious and airy. Lots of quality touches, superb tv with speaker in bathroom! IPod docking station, l'occitane toiletries etc. Staff were friendly and helpful, we arrived early and were able to park our car and leave all our bags/coats to be taken to our room, whilst we had a lovely wander around the village.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious, lots of choice and the best fruit smoothies i've ever tasted. We didn't eat in the restaurant as we have previously visited Hemsley and know plenty of good (cheaper) places to eat, however the food looked very nice and on our next vist (already booked!) we will definately be giving it a try.
reviews.title: Overpriced and overrated!

reviews.text: The hotel is well decorated and furnished throughout with lots of lovely comfy sofas, big mirrors etc and we loved all the original artwork that is on display and available to purchase. Drinks are expensive but it's kind of expected in this type of hotel. The spa was great, we didn't have any treatments booked as my husband had had a massage the previous day but used the sauna, steam room and hot tub. The heated pool was lovely, a rare treat to swim outdoors in England!
reviews.title: Luxury Spa Break
overpriced over rated dissapointed
reviews.text: Helsley is a lovely place to visit, lots of galleries and shops, castle well worth a visit and the walk to Rievaulx Abbey very nice.
All in all a lovely stay, wouldn't have changed a thing!
reviews.title: Great people, poor yet expensive food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Fiancee and I stayed here for 2 nights, making the most of the restaurant and spa facilities. We stayed in a standard room, which was nicely laid out and adequate - though very warm throughout the night needing a fan to keep cool. The spa is lovely and a great place to unwind.
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was very nice, with excellent service from knowledgeable staff and a great tasting and looking menu. The cheeseboard is also certainly worth trying!
reviews.title: Nice Relaxing Night Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a lovely stay and lives up to the expectations from it's website and the other reviews here.
reviews.title: By far the best place in Helmsley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a friday night here - rooms were comfy and well appointed (although B&O televisions in the rooms are always a pain - they look great but i can never quite work out how to use them)
reviews.title: Love it!!

reviews.text: Spa was great if a little on the small side. Didn't use the outside pool but it looked fab.
reviews.title: 2012 award for rude staff goes to..........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At £420 for a Spa suite on DB&B terms this hotel is asking top price and needs to deliver top service. Unfortunately it doesn't quite manage it. The check-in/welcome was poor but the room was spacious, quiet and clean (an unfortunate choice of bathroom tiles means the floor looks soiled but is in fact just marked). Dinner was well served but the food was no better than average (cheese trolley excepted which is excellent). However at breakfast next morning a 30 minute wait for 1 egg, 1 sausage and two slices of bacon is unacceptable. The heated outdoor pool is pleasant and I believe the Verbena Spa to be good.
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.text: Overall a pleasant experience but the price charged is not matched by the service.
reviews.title: Day Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As an aside, the Black Swan Hotel (4*) right in the middle of Helmsley provided a first class lunch, well and pleasantly served so, unless you really want the spa/pool, this might offer an alternative.
reviews.title: Good, but not as good as I thought it would be.

reviews.text: Whichever you choose Helmsley forms a pleasant and convenient base from which to visit some great areas - particularly Castle Howard and Fountains Abbey.
reviews.title: Family luxury 18th June

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely day at the spa with a friend. We paid £100 for a special offer, which included use of the outdoor pool and hot tub, indoor heat experience- aromatherapy room, salt steam room, sauna, foot spa, experience shower and ice tub. The offer included an Elemis facial of 1hr 15 mins, back massage of 30 mins, one course lunch and ice tea and water throughout the day.
reviews.title: Oh dear...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the early May bank holiday for 1 night dinner bed and breakfast, we booked a poolside suite which was lovely it had a wood burning fire in the lounge area and a small outside patio which would be nice in the summer, as it was early May we never used the patio or the pool but some did. The room was nice and bed comfortable the bathroom was good too with a separate shower, also the l'occitane toiletries were a nice touch.
reviews.title: Good Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was good we had the a la carte menu with 2 other guests who were not staying at the hotel, my only gripe with the restaurant was that as we were finishing off our wine at the end of the meal we were asked to leave the restaurant and go to the bar so they could set up for breakfast, the bar was busy so we went to our room to finish our drinks there this is not good practice in my mind.
reviews.title: Feversham arms hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was good with plenty of choice
reviews.title: Not worth the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a manicure at the salon that was ok but very highly priced for what you get also I don't think that painting nails across a treatment bed is the right way either, I have manicures at home and never had that at all, very strange.
reviews.title: Individual

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This would have been a truly lovely hotel when it opened, but now it is very tired, the carpets mostly being cream are dirty and not at all welcoming the room that we had (a suite) had everything you could want overlooking the pool, but the throw on the bed had stains on it (can't guess what they were but not nice at all) a small pot of biscuits that were meant for us had been part eaten, and a tea stain on the bath side, would we use this hotel again NO.
reviews.title: Great food, Friendly staff, Tired rooms

description: Beautifully set in the heart of Helmsley on the North Yorkshire Moors we’re one of the UK’s finest hotels offering the height of luxury to all our guests. As soon as you arrive you’ll understand what a special place the Feversham is, yet luxury doesn’t have to mean stuffy.At the Feversham, we’ve perfected the art of cosy. We’ve created the ideal retreat to escape the day and disappear for a while. Stepping across the threshold of any one of one of our 33 intimate and unique rooms you’ll feel completely at home and relaxed.From log burners in some rooms, deep comfy chairs and duck down duvets with Egyptian cotton sheets, to a state of the art Bang & Olufsen media centre, we’ve thought of everything to make your stay memorably restful.Critically acclaimed, the menu is constantly evolving to bring new, exciting dishes to your table, whilst complementing our reputation for serving the very finest food. Whether you choose to dine privately, in our beautiful restaurant, or on our poolside terrace, all our dishes are complemented by thoughtfully chosen fine wines from around the world.The luxurious Verbena Spa complements the hotel beautifully. A relaxing haven in which you can escape the pressures of life, our award winning spa is a world class retreat in a beautiful setting. This is a place where you can enjoy pamperfection with individual treatments available ranging from manicures through to full spa days, all using luxury products from some of the finest names. Our famous heat experience with saunarium, aromatherapy room, salt vapour room, monsoon shower, ice cave, foot spa, outdoor hot tub and heated pool, makes this the perfect place to kick back & relax.
